thread.title: Convenient Audio-Sharing Method Invented by InventHelp Client (LAX-630)
thread.title_full: Convenient Audio-Sharing Method Invented by InventHelp Client (LAX-630) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Convenient Audio-Sharing Method Invented by InventHelp Client (LAX-630)
text:
InventHelp, a Pittsburgh-based inventor service firm, is submitting the DUAL SHARED HEADPHONES to companies for their consideration.
PITTSBURGH, PA
An inventor from Los Angeles, Calif., thought about how nice it would be to be able to share music with his significant other or family member while at home, in the car or on a plane, so he designed a convenient way to do this.
The easy-to-use, versatile DUAL SHARED HEADPHONES provides a convenient way for two people to enjoy the same music, video game, TV show, movie or other audio. This promotes privacy, enjoyment and togetherness. It also prevents one person from being or feeling isolated. The idea is patent pending.
The original design was submitted to the Los Angeles office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-LAX-630, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
